title: Conditions
author: Emma Vidgen
cleaned_text: Conditions [Will 2023 be a bad year for allergies?](https://mydr.com.au/allergy/what-to-expect-from-allergy-season-2023/) The experts from Melbourne Pollen discuss allergy season 2023, what to expect and how to protect yourself [Reproductive health and your fertility](https://mydr.com.au/womens-health/pcos-endometriosis-fertility/) Conditions like PCOS and endometrosis impact thousands of women, but how do they affect fertility and pregnancy? We asked a reproductive biologist to explain [Protected: Effects and health risks of obesity](https://mydr.com.au/nutrition-weight/effects-of-obesity/) There is no excerpt because this is a protected post. [This is how a dermatologist treats nappy rash](https://mydr.com.au/babies-pregnancy/nappy-rash/) Baby skin expert and dermatologist Dr Deshan explains what causes nappy rash and the most effective treatments [Weight loss treatments and strategies](https://mydr.com.au/nutrition-weight/weight-loss-treatment/) Obesity expert Dr Georgia Rigas breaks down the different pathways to treating obesity from medication and lifestyle changes to surgery [Do you have Nomophobia?](https://mydr.com.au/mental-health/your-questions-answered-nomophobia/) Nomophobia, aka "NO MObile PHOne phoBIA," is the fear or anxiety of being without your mobile phone or being unable to use it. Do you have it? Find out here. [What is obesity?](https://mydr.com.au/nutrition-weight/what-is-obesity/) This article delves into the complex issues of obesity, examining its causes, consequences, and potential solutions. [Anxiety and depression in first-time fathers](https://mydr.com.au/mens-health/anxiety-and-depression-in-first-time-fathers/) New data reveals the prevalence of perinatal depression and anxiety in Australian fathers. Here are the most common symptoms, and where to get help. [What is Multiple Sclerosis (MS)?](https://mydr.com.au/neurological/what-is-multiple-sclerosis-ms/) Your Online Resource for Multiple Sclerosis (MS) - Your Guide to Understanding, Managing, and Thriving [Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) explained](https://mydr.com.au/autism/autism-spectrum-disorder-diagnosis-tests-myths/) Autism, autism spectrum disorder or ASD is a neurodivergent child development condition that affects the way children develop, learn and relate to the world. [Childhood eczema myths busted](https://mydr.com.au/sponsored-content/is-eczema-contagious/) Is eczema contagious? Do moisturisers cause flare-ups? Discover the truth about this often misunderstood condition, and how to treat and manage it at all ages. [Silicosis - what you need to know](https://mydr.com.au/lung-health/silicosis-symptoms-treatments-cure/) We ask the experts to explain the symptoms, causes and treatments for this serious lung disease. [What it feels like... to be diagnosed with hearing loss in your 30s](https://mydr.com.au/hearing-health/what-it-feels-like-to-be-diagnosed-with-hearing-loss-in-your-30s/) Do I really need hearing aids? At 38 it was the last thing I thought I'd be shopping for, but making peace with having hearing loss is one of the best things I've ever done. [Contact Dermatitis](https://mydr.com.au/skin-hair/contact-dermatitis/) Contact dermatitis can be easily treated with over the counter creams as well as topical and oral medications. [Bursitis](https://mydr.com.au/sports-fitness/bursitis/) Bursitis inflammation causes pains such as "tennis elbow". It's caused by repeated movement of certain joints and can be treated at home. [Fatty liver](https://mydr.com.au/gastrointestinal-health/fatty-liver/) Fatty liver is a condition most commonly found in heavy drinkers or people who are obese or have diabetes. There are usually no symptoms. [Pelvic Inflammatory Disease](https://mydr.com.au/womens-health/pelvic-inflammatory-disease-dr-norman-swan/) Pelvic Inflammatory Disease is caused by chlamydia and often goes unnoticed until it's too late and causes infertility. [Chronic Hepatitis B Infection](https://mydr.com.au/gastrointestinal-health/chronic-hepatitis-b-infection/) Chronic hepatitis B infection can result in cirrhosis and liver cancer. Find out about the risk factors and treatment for chronic hepatitis B. [White-tail spider bite - symptoms and treatment](https://mydr.com.au/allergy/white-tail-spider-bite/) Although a white-tail spider bite can be painful and cause temporary skin irritation, experts say it's very unlikely to cause skin ulcers and slow-healing wounds. [Idiopathic retroperitoneal fibrosis](https://mydr.com.au/gastrointestinal-health/idiopathic-retroperitoneal-fibrosis/) Idiopathic retroperitoneal fibrosis is a rare inflammatory condition that can lead to abdominal pain and kidney failure. [Cholera: Signs, symptoms and treatment](https://mydr.com.au/travel-health/cholera/) Cholera is a diarrhoeal illness caused by infection of the bowel with the bacterium Vibrio cholerae. A vaccine is available for this illness. [What is adult congenital heart disease?](https://mydr.com.au/heart-stroke/what-is-adult-congenital-heart-disease/) What does it mean to have adult congenital heart disease? Professor David Celermajer explains. [Bronchial asthma and cardiac asthma](https://mydr.com.au/asthma/bronchial-asthma-and-cardiac-asthma/) Cardiac asthma is not a form of asthma, but actually breathing difficulties caused by heart failure. Find out how it differs from bronchial asthma. [Asthma and gastro-oesophageal reflux](https://mydr.com.au/gastrointestinal-health/asthma-and-gastric-reflux/) Asthma and gastro-oesophageal reflux disease often occur together, but does one condition trigger the other? [Child development milestones](https://mydr.com.au/babies-pregnancy/child-development-milestones/) Developmental milestones are things most children can do by a certain age. View the developmental milestones of a child from birth to 24 months. [What are the ongoing issues with congenital heart disease?](https://mydr.com.au/heart-stroke/what-are-the-ongoing-issues-with-congenital-heart-disease/) So young adults with inborn heart... [Diabetes and getting pregnant](https://mydr.com.au/babies-pregnancy/diabetes-and-getting-pregnant/) How will having diabetes affect your pregnancy and your baby? And what planning do you need to do first? [Preterm labour](https://mydr.com.au/babies-pregnancy/preterm-labour/) Going into labour before your 37th week of pregnancy is called preterm labour, or premature labour. Find out what it means for you and your baby. [What is Thyroid Cancer?](https://mydr.com.au/cancer-care/what-is-thyroid-cancer/) What is thyroid cancer and what can be done about it? Oncologist Professor Michael Boyer advises. [Asthma, pregnancy and breastfeeding](https://mydr.com.au/babies-pregnancy/asthma-pregnancy-and-breast-feeding/) Your most pressing questions about asthma and its impact on breastfeeding, answered. [Brain cancer](https://mydr.com.au/cancer-care/brain-cancer/) What are the symptoms of brain cancer? And are there any treatments? Find out from Professor Michael Boyer. [Peptic ulcers](https://mydr.com.au/gastrointestinal-health/peptic-ulcers/) An ulcer is an area of damage to the lining of the stomach or upper part of the intestine. [What is throat cancer?](https://mydr.com.au/cancer-care/what-is-throat-cancer/) Throat cancer is a generic term that applies to cancers of usually the mouth, the back of the nose, the top of the throat, and even right down into the voice box. [Mosquito-borne diseases and prevention](https://mydr.com.au/travel-health/mosquito-borne-disease-prevention/) Mosquito bites can be the cause of a number of illnesses, even in Australia. Here's how to protect yourself. [Accidental poisoning](https://mydr.com.au/first-aid-self-care/accidental-poisoning/) Children's curiosity can lead to danger, such as unintentional poisoning. [Is cannabis abuse harmful?](https://mydr.com.au/mental-health/is-cannabis-abuse-harmful/) Long term cannabis abuse affects the user detrimentally - both biologically, psychologically, and socially. Dr Matt Cullen explains. [I'm worried my child has an eating disorder](https://mydr.com.au/mental-health/im-worried-my-child-has-an-eating-disorder/) If you think your child has an eating disorder, there are steps you can take to help. Dr Matt Cullen elaborates. [HIV & AIDS Resources](https://mydr.com.au/sexual-health/conditions-hiv-and-aids/) MyDr's comprehensive guide on HIV & AIDS covers causes, symptoms, diagnosis, treatment & prevention. Learn how to manage this condition with MyDr. [Hand, foot and mouth disease](https://mydr.com.au/kids-teens-health/hand-foot-and-mouth-disease/) Hand, foot and mouth disease (HFMD) is a common childhood illness causing mouth sores and a skin rash. Read about the symptoms, treatment and how to prevent infection by this viral illness. [Deep vein thrombosis](https://mydr.com.au/heart-stroke/deep-vein-thrombosis/) Deep vein thrombosis (DVT) occurs when a blood clot forms in the deep veins of the leg. Find out about symptoms, causes, treatment and prevention. [Polio: symptoms, causes and treatment](https://mydr.com.au/kids-teens-health/polio-what-you-need-to-know/) Polio is an infectious disease that can cause permanent muscle weakness, paralysis, and in severe cases, can be life-threatening. [Kidney stones - symptoms, causes and treatment](https://mydr.com.au/pain/kidney-stones/) Kidney stones: find out the causes, symptoms (including renal colic), tests and treatments. Also, how to prevent kidney stones from recurring. [I have OCD: what should I do?](https://mydr.com.au/mental-health/i-have-ocd-what-should-i-do/) OCD has some typical symptoms, which are obsessions and compulsions. Dr Matt Cullen explains what to do if you think you have OCD. [How can I support my child who has anorexia?](https://mydr.com.au/mental-health/how-can-i-support-my-child-who-has-anorexia/) If your child has anorexia, what are the most important things you can do to help? Dr Matt Cullen, Psychiatrist, reveals what's key. [How do I talk to someone I think is depressed?](https://mydr.com.au/mental-health/how-do-i-talk-to-someone-i-think-is-depressed/) Talking to someone who is depressed, particularly if you're a friend or family member, is a very important and in some ways can be extremely helpful. [How do you know if you're at risk of heart failure?](https://mydr.com.au/heart-stroke/risk-of-heart-failure/) What is heart failure and what are the symptoms? Professor David Celermajer explains. [What is endometriosis? A brief video explainer](https://mydr.com.au/womens-health/what-is-endometriosis/) Endometriosis is a painful condition caused by the spread of tissue from the lining of the uterus into other parts of the body. [What are the most common autoimmune diseases?](https://mydr.com.au/first-aid-self-care/what-are-the-most-common-autoimmune-diseases/) Autoimmune diseases are diseases where the immune system attacks the body. Dr Norman Swan explains which are the most common. [What is kidney damage?](https://mydr.com.au/first-aid-self-care/what-is-kidney-damage/) Chronic kidney disease is common in Australia. Dr Norman Swan outlines what you can do to prevent it. [What is Klinefelter syndrome?](https://mydr.com.au/mens-health/what-is-klinefelter-syndrome/) Klinefelter syndrome is a genetic disorder where a male, instead of having just an X and a Y chromosome, has two Xs, and a Y.
